qa_pairs.question: What academic positions has Ashkan Nikeghbali held at the University of Zurich, and how do they relate to his research areas in financial mathematics and probability theory?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Ashkan Nikeghbali holds the chair of Financial Mathematics at the University of Zurich, which directly aligns with his research in financial mathematics and probability theory.<cite>[S2][S8]</cite></statement> <statement>He was appointed assistant professor at the Institute of Mathematics at the University of Zurich in March 2007 and was promoted to Extraordinary Professor of Applied Mathematics there in 2009, roles that support his academic work in probability theory and financial mathematics.<cite>[S7]</cite></statement> <statement>Nikeghbali's research areas, including financial mathematics, probability theory, and analytic number theory, are reflected in his academic positions and contributions at the University of Zurich.<cite>[S8]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Ashkan Nikeghbali


# Ashkan Nikeghbali



**Ashkan Nikeghbali Cisakht** (Persian: اشکان نیکبالی; born September 15,ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ 1975) is a Frenchᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ mathematician and university professor of Iranian descentᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ. [S2] He holds the chair of Financial Mathematics at the University of Zurich. [S3] ## Academic career

Nikeghbali obtained his PhD at the Pierre and Marie Curie University in 2005 with the thesis "Temps aléatoires, filtrations et sous-martingales: quelques développements récents", supervised by Marc Yor. [S4] Prior to that, he was a researcher from February 2004 to July 2004 at the Isaac Newton Institute on the topic of "Random matrix approaches in number theory." After completing his PhD, Nikeghbali first worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the American Institute of Mathematics (under the direction of Brian Conrey) at University of Rochester. [S5] In June 2006, he was appointed Heinz-Hopf Lecturer at ETH Zurich. [S6] In March 2007, Nikeghbali was appointed assistant professor at the Institute of Mathematics at the University of Zurich. [S7] He was promoted to Extraordinary Professor of Applied Mathematics there in 2009.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ


## Research

Nikeghbali's research focuses on financial mathematics, probability theory, and analytic number theory. [S8] In particular, he works in the areas of portfolio theory, stochastic processes, random operators and matrices, and the application of stochastics in number theory and combinatorics.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ

In asymptotic probability theory, Nikeghbali, together with Féray, Méliot, and Kowalski introduced the concept of Mod-Ф convergence. [S9] In number theory, he, together with Chhaibi and Najnudel, introduced the concept of stochastic zeta function.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ

Nikeghbali supervised at least six PhD students during his time at the University of Zurich. [S10] ## Other activities

Member of the world.minds community since 2008.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ Member of the Scientific Advisory Board of swissQuant. [S11] Member of the advisory board of EVMTech. [S12] Strategy advisor for data analysis and modeling of stochastic processes at Roche Holding in Basel.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ


## Awards

Honorary doctorate from the University of Alba Iulia in Romania.

qa_pairs.question: How does Ashkan Nikeghbali's involvement in organizations like swissQuant, EVMTech, and Roche Holding reflect his professional contributions beyond academia?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Ashkan Nikeghbali's involvement in organizations like swissQuant, EVMTech, and Roche Holding highlights his contributions to applying academic expertise in financial mathematics and stochastic processes to industry needs.<cite>[S11][S12][S13]</cite></statement><statement>As a member of the Scientific Advisory Board of swissQuant, he likely influences advancements in quantitative finance and risk management, bridging theoretical research with practical applications.<cite>[S11]</cite></statement><statement>His role on the advisory board of EVMTech further underscores his engagement in leveraging stochastic models for real-world problem-solving, particularly in financial technology and data analysis.<cite>[S12]</cite></statement><statement>Additionally, his position as a strategy advisor at Roche Holding emphasizes his expertise in data analysis and stochastic processes, contributing to innovative approaches in healthcare and pharmaceutical research.<cite>[S13]</cite></statement>
